item.title: Building Low-Latency Microservices in GoLang
item.description:
âš¡ Building Low-Latency Microservices in GoLang

At TCS, I built exchange simulators processing millions of orders. Here's how we achieved sub-millisecond latency:

Key Strategies:

  • Goroutine Pools - Avoid goroutine spawning overhead
  • Memory Pooling - Reuse objects to reduce GC pressure
  • Zero-Copy Serialization - Using protocol buffers efficiently
  • Linux Tuning - TCP_NODELAY, SO_REUSEPORT optimizations

Sample Code:

// Worker pool pattern
func NewWorkerPool(size int) *WorkerPool {
    pool := &WorkerPool{
        tasks: make(chan Task, 1000),
        workers: size,
    }
    for i := 0; i < size; i++ {
        go pool.worker()
    }
    return pool
}

Join next week's edition where I'll cover Kafka integration patterns!

During my CodeChef internship, I learned what makes a good competitive programming problem:

Problem Design Principles:

  • Clear Statement - No ambiguity in problem description
  • Progressive Difficulty - Multiple approaches possible
  • Comprehensive Test Cases - Edge cases and large inputs
  • Educational Value - Teaches a specific concept

Example Problem Structure:

Problem: Find the k-th smallest element
Difficulty: Medium
Concepts: QuickSelect, Priority Queues
